text:
Single Exponential Smoothing, SES for short, also called Simple Exponential Smoothing, is a
time series forecasting method for univariate data without a trend or seasonality. It requires a
single parameter, called alpha (a or α), also called the smoothing factor or smoothing coeﬃcient.
This parameter controls the rate at which the inﬂuence of the observations at prior time steps
decay exponentially. Alpha is often set to a value between 0 and 1. Large values mean that the
